revised_title: Effects of Lesions on Different Regions of the Cerebral Hemispheres
tldr: The authors investigate the effects of lesions on different regions of the cerebral hemispheres in monkeys, focusing on the angular gyri and occipital lobes. They find that despite significant damage to the occipital lobe, vision remains unaffected, while damage to the prefrontal regions leads to a change in the animal's behavior and mental state.
